intro: Aphyllodium latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf ghostflower, is a unique plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant has reduced leaves, with most of its photosynthetic function carried out by its broad, flat stems. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. Aphyllodium latifolium is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems.
